newsitem.title: UK: Cat rates will only shift if $50 bln loss -actuary.
newsitem.headline: Cat rates will only shift if $50 bln loss -actuary.

text.p: Tillinghast principal John Ryan said on Wednesday it would take a $50 billion disaster to shift property catastrophe rates,.
"Another Hurricane Andrew that cost $30 billion would just stabilise the market," he said.
If there is no disaster of this magnitude, only a stock market crash would be significant enough to put pressure on rates.

Speaking at an alternative risk financing conference, Ryan said insurers, including catastrophe insurers which use securitisation as a means of diversifying portfolios, are effectively utilising excess capital.
This will lead to some smoothing of the insurance cycle.
As well as some widely publicised securitisation transactions, such as the recent USAA deal, Ryan said there would be an increase in the number of banking contracts.

These contracts are a means by which a bank provides a loan to the insurer when a specific event occurs but the terms are negotiated in advance. It is a means for the insurer to secure capital to write business without transferring risk.
